GLScreenshot Class Reference

#include <GLScreenshot.h>

List of all members.

GLScreenshot.cpp

The GLScreenshot class implements the functionality to read out pixel-data from the GL frame-buffer and save it into a picture-format supported by WX

Date:
2008-10-28
Author:
Konstantin Balabin <k.balabin@googlemail.com>

Patrick Kracht <patrick.kracht@googlemail.com>

Thorsten Moll <thorsten.moll@googlemail.com>

Valentin Kunz <athostr@googlemail.com>

void GLScreenshot::create (  )  [private]

Read out pixels from GL and save it to a picture

Definition at line 38 of file GLScreenshot.cpp.

00039 {
00040         int viewport[4];
00041         glGetIntegerv(GL_VIEWPORT, viewport);
00042         
00043         // read out viewport-size
00044         m_width = viewport[2];
00045         m_height = viewport[3];
00046         
00047         const size_t imageSizeInBytes = m_bytesPerPixel * size_t(m_width) * size_t(m_height);
00048         
00049         // Allocate with malloc, because the data will be managed by wxImage
00050         unsigned char* pPicData = static_cast<unsigned char*>(malloc(imageSizeInBytes));
00051         
00052         // read pixels from GL
00053         glPixelStorei(GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT, 1);
00054         glReadPixels(0, 0, m_width, m_height, GL_RGB, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, pPicData);
00055         
00056         swapPixels(pPicData);
00057         
00058         // create an image and save it
00059         wxImage mypic(m_width, m_height, pPicData);
00060         mypic.SaveFile(m_filename);
00061 }

void GLScreenshot::swapPixels ( unsigned char *  pPicData  )  [private]

Reverse pixels, given from bottom-left to top right by glReadPixels

Parameters:
unsigned char* Pointer to picture-data-array

Definition at line 69 of file GLScreenshot.cpp.

00070 {
00071         for (int y = 0; y < m_height / 2; y++)
00072         {
00073                 const int swapY = m_height - y - 1;
00074                 for (int x = 0; x < m_width; x++)
00075                 {
00076                         const int offset = int(m_bytesPerPixel) * (x + y * m_width);
00077                         const int swapOffset = int(m_bytesPerPixel) * (x + swapY * m_width);
00078                         
00079                         // Swap R, G and B of the 2 pixels
00080                         std::swap(pPicData[offset + 0], pPicData[swapOffset + 0]);
00081                         std::swap(pPicData[offset + 1], pPicData[swapOffset + 1]);
00082                         std::swap(pPicData[offset + 2], pPicData[swapOffset + 2]);
00083                 }
